instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.820-1987: What is 820-1987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Storage size on 2018+ MacBooks
threads.message:
I am trying to learn about replacing the NAND on the new MacBooks, I have a programmer and it comes with some of the firmwares, not all but this is a start. The problem I am having is that according to the NAND models I have looked into so far the MacBooks I have looked at have weird storage sizes, for example on a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> the board comes with x3 TSB4226 this are 64Gb each and this board also has a TSB4227 this one is 128Gb and that comes to a total of 320Gb, however this Macs only came in either 256Gb and 512Gb and maybe 1Tb, can anyone please tell me what I am missing?

Thanks and if I can get any of this working I will post here.

threads.title: Storage size on 2018+ MacBooks
threads.message: All NAND combinations are listed on the page 92 of schematic (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>).
